intro: Clitandropsis insularis, commonly known as the island clitandropsis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
